intro: Heterotis rotundifolia, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and clusters of showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its attractive appearance. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for indoor gardening and botanical study.
